** HSBC upgrades stock rating of British asset manager abrdn ABDN.L to "buy" from "hold," raises PT to 300p from 270p, implies 24.6% upside to stock's last close

** Shares up 2.83% at 247.40p

** Last week, co said it would buy investment platform interactive investor for 1.49 bln pounds ($1.97 bln) in cash, as traditional asset managers seek to build up customers using online providers (Full Story)

** Brokerage says the proposed acquisition of interactive investor is a game-changer for co and accelerates its growth strategy

** Says the acquisition is important for abrdn, as it brings substantial access to the high-growth rates on offer in the UK direct investing platform market

** Adds management has a clear ambition to utilise its "excess cash in M&A in areas that add businesses/portfolios which abrdn might be missing, and/or brings scale to under-sized businesses/portfolios at abrdn"

** Stock down 14.5% this year, as of last close


($1 = 0.7553 pounds)



(Reporting By Geetha Panchaksharam)
